intro: Stephania brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed stephania, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by distinctive, elongated berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
